summary: HCSM News ~ Canadian among trio awarded Nobel Prize in Physics
title: HCSM News ~ Canadian among trio awarded Nobel Prize in Physics
body:
Donna Strickland, an associate professor at the University of Waterloo in Ontario, became the first woman in 55 years and the third ever to win the Nobel Prize in Physics, sharing it with a scientist from the U.S. and another from France for their work in laser physics.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/nobel-prize-physics-canadian-donna-strickland-1.4846644?cmp=rss

description:
This was an odd first month of the college football season. Not just because a bunch of odd things happened but also because there were five Saturdays in the month. If you think about that, it means that nearly half of the college football season is finished for teams that play 12 games. And October just now got here.

summary: Strengthening back for long term standing via /r/Fitness
title: Strengthening back for long term standing via /r/Fitness
body:
I’m 48, in pretty good shape. I swim three times a week about 3000 yards and strength train twice a week (pullups, pushups, lunges, occasional wind sprints, that sort of thing). Once a year work a booth at a trades show where I have to stand three hours at a time, otherwise I have a classic desk job. This standing kills me, just kills me. My ankles hurt, my knees hurt, my calves hurt, and my back hurts (mostly above the kidneys on each side, but also up to the clavicle. I am mildly flat footed and I try to wear comfortable shoes, but they have to be business shoes. Before I was in this good shape, I would go to the doctor when it happened and they would put me in exercise therapy for a few weeks and I’d feel better, but I don’t know if it was the therapy or the not-having-to-stand that fixed me.

My question is: are there exercises that train muscles for long term standing? I’ve thought about a few times a week just standing 90 minutes or so in my day to train, but it’s hard to maintain in my job.

TL;DNR - How do I train my back to endure hours of standing?

Thanks so much in advance!

​

via reddit https://ift.tt/2DQF7oi

summary: The New Rules of Losing Body Fat
title: The New Rules of Losing Body Fat
body:
According to the Harvard School of Public Health and wellness, Americans are eating much less fat compared to ever before. While this may sound in the beginning like a win for our overweight populace, it’s in fact a big cause for issue. Compared with HALF A CENTURY ago, we’re eating a lot less fat, yet diabetes is 10 times extra widespread and the percent of obese adults has tripled to a shocking 39%.

Let’s face it: Fat has actually obtained a bum rap.

Why would we believe it’s an excellent concept to consume something that we so frantically aim to eliminate, spending many hours on the elliptical exerciser attempting to lose every calorie we consume?

Because of the widespread witch hunt against fat, low-fat diet plans have actually ended up being some of the most preferred methods to reduce weight. As we’ll see, consuming dietary fats (and also being smart about exactly what types) is really productive towards your weight loss dish plan.

Rule 1. Get To Know Your Fats

Instead of avoiding fat, the new way to approach this vital macronutrient is in recognizing all the many types it appears in.

Saturated fat has actually constantly been, by far, the most misunderstood. At a chemical level, a saturated fat is made up of fatty acid chains that are completely saturated with hydrogen atoms and also exhibit mainly solitary bonds between carbon atoms. This saturation makes the chains stiffer, as well as thus saturated fats are solid at space temperature. As an example, think of butter or the white marbling you locate in an excellent cut of steak and even cooled bacon fat( far better research on is bacon good for you initially though).

Besides being in meat and milk items, saturated fat is also located in avocados, in addition to in palm and also coconut oils. This sort of fat is very important for proper body operating as it makes up regarding 50% of cell membranes, contributing structural honesty as well as stiffness. Hydrogenated fat is likewise important in the unification of calcium right into skeletal tissue, adding much to bone and also teeth health. As we’ll talk about in the future, high nutritional usage of saturated fat has actually long been related to boosted incidence of heart problem. Yet, brand-new searchings for are showing that it’s much better for us compared to we thought.

Unsaturated fats are the next group of fats you should know with. Unlike hydrogenated fat, this type has dual bonds between carbon atoms along its fat chain. Because of this structure, unsaturated fats are a lot more adaptable and flowing compared to the saturated selection. They look like fluids at room temperature.

There are 2 sorts of unsaturated fats: Monounsaturated and also polyunsaturated. Monounsaturated fats have one dual bond along their fatty acid chains and also are linked with the reduction of poor cholesterol and decreased danger of stroke and also heart disease. This sort of fat is discovered in olives, olive oil, sesame, sunflower oil, nuts as well as seeds. It’s an excellent kind of fat and also there’s no requirement to restrict your intake.This will also help you in how you can eliminate reduced stomach fat.

This Is Why Fatty Acids Are Good

Polyunsaturated fats have greater than one dual bond along their fat chain as well as can be found in two kinds. These kinds are omega-3 as well as omega-6 fatty acids. Omega-3s and also omega-6s are both considered crucial fatty acids. Anytime the word vital appears in nourishment, it shows that the body cannot make the loved one nutrient and also that it should be gotten via diet.

Omega-6s are discovered in corn-fed meat and dairy, vegetable oils as well as processed foods. Omega-3s show up in oily fish such as salmon and mackerel, in addition to yard fed meat, fish oil as well as flax seeds. One of the most vital thing to think about when thinking about omega-3 and also 6 is the ratio in our diet regimen. As well as there are a lots of fish oil advantages.

Omega-3s are counter-inflammatory. Omega-6s are pro-inflammatory. When an optimal proportion is achieved between both, your body can operate effectively. The optimal ratio of omega-6s to omega-3s is 1:1. Regretfully, many Americans take in a proportion of 20:1 to 40:1. This out of proportion amount has been connected to a rise in mental health problem, discovering conditions, depression as well as schizophrenia. It’s also been connected to a greater threat of cancer cells, heart disease as well as arthritis.So it’s crucial to think about the fish oil brain benefits.

Stay Away From Trans Fats

The last type, and also the one to stay clear of like the torment, is trans fat. Assume of trans fats as Frankenstein’s beast of the fat world. Trans fats are synthetically produced as well as were originally made in an effort to increase the life span of food as well as to displace saturated fats.

In essence, trans fats are mono- or poly-unsaturated fats that are denatured via hydrogenation. Their artificial framework makes them tough to integrate right into the body (simply like Monster’s beast never really fit in the human globe). Researchers soon located that trans fats caused transformed cell membranes and negatively affected cell membrane layers to the point at which cells can not execute their appointed functions.

This kind of fat is discovered in deep fried foods, processed baked goods such as cookies as well as muffins, and also shortening. In an effort to disguise the trans fat web content of particular foods, it’s frequently provided as hydrogenated oil, partly hydrogenated oil or fractionated oil.

Rule 2. Eat Fat To Lose Fat

One point that those that stick to a low-fat diet are forgetting is that fat is one of the 3 important macronutrients. The other 2 are carbs and also healthy protein. We can think about each of these macronutrients as a leg to a feces. If among the legs reduces, after that the entire feces topples over as well as can’t function. When you limit one kind of macronutrient in your diet, you incidentally replace it with another.

In most instances, people who restrict their fat intake wind up eating more carbohydrates. Refined foods that are marketed as being slim are frequently packed with sugar to make for the absence in preference. It utilized to be that carbohydrates were considered one of the most vital dietary gas source for athletes.

Recently, it’s emerged compared to an extra of carbs could bring about metabolic disturbances and weight gain. You can likewise explore carbohydrate biking results, which is also incredibly popular. The Dietary Guidelines Advisory Board recommends that athletes attempt reducing their carbohydrate consumption and concentrate on incorporating more healthy fats right into their diet plans. As a matter of fact, some professional athletes are encouraged to derive up to 75% of their calories from fat!

Serving up a massive 9 kcal per gram, fat triumphes as the most power thick macronutrient.

Why?

Protein and also carbohydrates provide only 4kcal of power each gram each. That’s why if you don’t have sufficient fat in your diet regimen, you do not have enough gas for your fat burning plan.

Eating Healthy Fats Conditions Your Body

According to the Washington School of Medicine in St Louis, old fat kicking back your abdominal muscles and also thighs cannot be melted without the help of brand-new fat. New, healthy dietary fats presented to the body turn on PPAR-alpha and fat-burning paths in the liver, aiding you to slim down. Monounsaturated fats specifically (such as those found in olive oil) are beneficial in maintaining blood sugar level levels. This helps regulate yearnings and urges healthy eating patterns.

The result? 

They’re inadequate at conditioning your body to burn fat efficiently.

Adiponectin levels in the body could be adversely impacted by a diet plan that’s low in healthy and balanced fats. Adiponectin is a hormonal agent that motivates reliable metabolic rate and enhanced prices of fat malfunction in the body. This causes fewer food desires. One more benefit of taking in a diet plan high in healthy fats is that this particular macronutrient doesn’t pass with the digestion system quickly. That suggests it assists you really feel satiated for longer durations of time.

Diets reduced in fat leave you really feeling always starving.

You will certainly require to include a slim fat exercise for sure.

The result?

You might compensate by binging on carbs or snacking exceedingly between dishes to quiet that vacant feeling in your gut. An additional advantage of fat’s slow-moving digestion rate is that it also slows the food digestion of the various other macronutrients. Including fat to your diet regimen reduces the failure of carbs as well as ultimately, your body could concentrate rather on burning fat reserves.

Rule 3. Eat Fat To Recover

Eating a diet high in healthy fat is a wonderful way to encourage recuperation to build lean, solid muscle as well as is your ideal means on how you can obtain muscle mass. As it ends up, fats serve several objectives apart from aiding to fill in your everyday calorie goals.

Steroid hormonal agents, as an example, are acquired from fat and also dictate just how your body responds to the high-energy needs of workout. A lack of these hormonal agents will certainly impact healing as well as encouraged an extended inflammatory state.

As discussed, a discrepancy in between omega-3 and 6 fats in your diet regimen also advertises swelling. Focusing on having a higher proportion of omega-3s (oily fish, flax seed) will certainly make certain that your body approaches the counter-inflammatory state as well as will assist speed muscle recuperation. As a result of fat’s function as a crucial element of mobile membranes, it’s essential for boosting the dimension of muscle cells, along with healthy protein concentration in your body. This assists you build muscle mass.

Dietary fat is additionally crucial for positively influencing testosterone degrees, a crucial muscle-building hormonal agent for ladies and men. Intense training could reduce the body immune system. Fat can assist in constructing up your body’s defenses throughout this depleted state.

Fats Aid Your Vitamin Intake

Vitamins A, D, K and also E are the fat-soluble vitamins. They’re far better absorbed in the visibility of dietary fat. That’s why you need to constantly take them with food. These not only nourish your body, yet also assist to fortify your body’s all-natural defense against attacking virus. They’re also accountable for maintaining your hair shiny, your skin clear, and for taking in calcium right into the skeletal system for solid bones as well as teeth.

Fatty acids likewise compose the myelin finishing of neurons. This helps your nerve system communicate. As you can see, nutritional fats are required in maintaining your mind and body noise and healthy. They aid you reap all the rewards of your workout. A diet reduced in fat could bring about vitamin An and also vitamin D deficiencies. You do not desire that. Why? That leaves your body susceptible to disease, fatigue as well as depression.

Rule 4. Fail to remember The Saturated Fat Myth

Saturated fats have actually been steered clear of for several years.

Why?

Their intended connect to cardiovascular disease. Brand-new research shows that isn’t really always the situation. Inning accordance with the American Dietetic Organization, hydrogenated fats really have been revealed to elevate HDL (great) cholesterol degrees. When you replace saturated fats with carbs, these degrees go down.

Researchers are finding that the resource of fat (like if the pet was fed corn or yard) is much more important compared to the type. Actually, hydrogenated fat has been a human nutritional staple because the Paleolithic era. The Inuit people of Alaska are notorious for their diet plan of whale meat as well as blubber. It offers them with 70% of their nutritional calories from fat, but they have an extremely reduced incidence of heart disease.

And they typically aren’t the only ones. Numerous individuals across the globe eat high degrees of hydrogenated fat and also continue to be designs of ideal wellness. Weston Price, a Cleveland dental professional and also nourishment researcher, traveled to Switzerland, New Zealand, and Africa, to name a few, to examine their diet regimens. He tried to discover why they were designs of good health. He discovered they all shared a typical string. They all gotten 30 to 80% of their calories from fat, as well as one of the most prevalent dietary fat was of the saturated variety.

To now, the Weston Rate structure motivates consuming high degrees of saturated fat. Particularly, they recommend consuming those of pet origin. Why? To reinforce the immune system, facilitate mobile communication, secure against diabetes as well as suppress inflammation.

The reduced fat craze in The U.S.A. has actually resulted in a too much intake of processed foods as well as improved carbs. Yet, the reality is that your body requires saturated fats to operate properly. As well as there are numerous good diets available to support this. The Atkins diet regimen, the Ketogenic diet regimen, the Paleo diet and the Weston Price Standard Foods diet regimen all share the common belief that reducing carbs and boosting nutritional fats sustains optimal weight and also total body health.

Conclusion

In a day and also age where fat is towered above as the primary offender in weight gain, we should remember that fat isn’t really the true enemy. It’s the package fat is supplied to us in. Fat is good.

That expression could make you desire to run out as well as supply up on frozen pizzas as well as hot dogs, but maintain in mind that these foods have trans fat, the Frankenstein’s beast selection.

Eat healthy fats. Your body requires it. Select turf fed meats as well as dairy to obtain your everyday dosage of body immune system sustaining hydrogenated fats. Select fresh salmon, mackerel or tuna. Include some flax seeds to your following smoothie mix to up your omega-3 levels. As well as lastly, select natural, plant obtained oils such as avocado, coconut or added virgin olive oils. Ditch the extremely processed soybean or corn oils. If you make these smart options, you’ll see that dropping weight does not need to imply sacrificing flavor.

By Lillian Dumont

Yet, the reality is that your body requires saturated fats to operate properly. As well as there are numerous good diets available to support this. The Atkins diet regimen, the Ketogenic diet regimen, the Paleo diet and the Weston Price Standard Foods diet regimen all share the common belief that reducing carbs and boosting nutritional fats sustains optimal weight and also total body health.

Conclusion

In a day and also age where fat is towered above as the primary offender in weight gain, we should remember that fat isn’t really the true enemy. It’s the package fat is supplied to us in. Fat is good.

That expression could make you desire to run out as well as supply up on frozen pizzas as well as hot dogs, but maintain in mind that these foods have trans fat, the Frankenstein’s beast selection.

Eat healthy fats. Your body requires it. Select turf fed meats as well as dairy to obtain your everyday dosage of body immune system sustaining hydrogenated fats. Select fresh salmon, mackerel or tuna. Include some flax seeds to your following smoothie mix to up your omega-3 levels. As well as lastly, select natural, plant obtained oils such as avocado, coconut or added virgin olive oils. Ditch the extremely processed soybean or corn oils. If you make these smart options, you’ll see that dropping weight does not need to imply sacrificing flavor.

By Lillian Dumont

summary: Is Lobster Good for You?
title: Is Lobster Good for You?
body:
Consumer Reports has no financial relationship with advertisers on this site.

Consumer Reports has no financial relationship with advertisers on this site.

When people sing the praises of seafood, fatty fishes like salmon and mackerel seem to get all the attention. Though lobster can’t quite match those omega-3 powerhouses, it’s not without its unique nutritional benefits. So how can you harness the healthiness of lobster without the potential pitfalls? It’s all in how you serve it. 

Nutritional High Notes

A 3½-ounce serving of lobster has 89 calories, 19 grams of protein, and less than 1 gram of fat, making it a lean, low-calorie source of protein.

Like other shellfish, lobster is also packed with nutrients. “Lobster provides a significant amount of minerals, such as zinc, calcium, phosphorus, selenium, and potassium, as well as B vitamins,” says Faye L. Dong, Ph.D., professor emerita, department of food science and human nutrition, University of Illinois. It’s also a low-mercury type of seafood. Mercury (a heavy metal) in fish is a concern, especially for women of childbearing age and young children, because it can damage the brain and nerves.

Though it doesn’t contain as many of the healthy omega-3 fats as some other types of seafood, you’re still getting 83 mg in a 3½-ounce serving. “If you eat lobster one day a week and a fattier fish like salmon one or two times a week, you’ll have your omega-3 intake covered for the week,” says Eric Rimm, Sc.D., professor of epidemiology and nutrition, Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health. 

What About the Cholesterol?

Lobster gets a bad rap for being high in cholesterol. And compared with some other foods, it is. A 3½-ounce serving of lean top sirloin steak, for example, has 64 mg of cholesterol, and the same amount of lobster has 145 mg. But a serving of lobster actually contains less cholesterol than an egg, which has 187 mg. “Dietary cholesterol isn’t as important as was once thought,” says Rimm. “In the context of an overall healthy diet, dietary cholesterol is not strongly related to an increase in blood cholesterol or heart disease.”  

Saturated fat is the more important thing to focus on when it comes to managing your cholesterol levels and risk of heart disease. And lobster has practically no saturated fat.

Eating a diet that’s high in saturated fat has been shown to increase overall cholesterol levels as well as negatively tipping the balance between “good” HDL and “bad” LDL cholesterol. That’s why the current dietary guidelines call for limiting your intake of saturated fat to 10 percent or less of your daily calories. Saturated fat has also been directly linked to an increased risk of heart disease. A 2016 study published in The BMJ found that those who consumed diets highest in saturated fat had an 18 percent greater risk than those who consumed the least.

But if you’re concerned about dietary cholesterol, pay attention to the portion size of your lobster. “It’s typical to be served half a lobster,” says Dong. “That’s about 8 ounces of lobster meat, which contains about 300 milligrams of cholesterol.”

Tips for Healthier Lobster Meals

The real problem with lobster is how it’s typically served. “Dousing your lobster with melted butter is a quick way to more than double the amount of calories and fat you’re consuming,” Rimm says. Mixing it with mayonnaise and piling it into a doughy white roll isn’t much better.

Though these are the most popular preparations, “for most people they are a treat eaten only a few times a year,” says Michael Serpa, chef and partner at the Select Oyster Bar in Boston.

For frequent lobster eaters, there are plenty of ways to enjoy it while keeping it a healthy, low-fat food.

Serpa suggests skipping the melted butter and dipping your steamed lobster in some aioli or a spicy vinaigrette. Unlike butter, which is mostly saturated fat, the primary fats in these are the healthier monounsaturated or polyunsaturated types. “Or split the lobster, grill it with lemon and herbs, and serve it over fresh salad greens,” he says.

For those who take issue with dropping live lobsters directly into a pot of boiling water, there are some, potentially more humane, options. You can put the lobster in the freezer or ice water for an hour before cooking or use a sharp knife to pierce the area directly behind the eyes before boiling it.

title: College Basketball Top 25 for 2018-19 https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
The Athlon Sports College Basketball Top 25 is littered with familiar faces, especially at the top where Kansas has edged Kentucky for the No. 1 spot in our preseason rankings. 

The Wildcats are once again loaded with elite freshmen, but this team also brings back three sophomores who played key roles last season — giving John Calipari’s team the type of veteran leadership usually lacking in Lexington. At Kansas, Bill Self has a roster led by junior big man Udoka Azubuike and several key transfers who will be stepping into prominent roles.


Read the full story on Athlon Sports

summary: Thick Girls Need Love Too!
title: Thick Girls Need Love Too!
body:
Thick Girls Need Love Too!

Thick girls need love too! Not just advice on how to get slender. Not advice on what they can and cannot eat or drink on a daily basis. Thick women are beautiful, adventurous, filled with big brains and big hearts and some MF’s need to start recognizing and respecting this fact. 

I’ve been on both ends of the spectrum! I’ve been 311 and I’ve been 180! Now, I won’t lie at 180 I was at my peak…

summary: The 10 best tips to improve your health now from Dr. Oz’s buddy Bryce Wylde
title: The 10 best tips to improve your health now from Dr. Oz’s buddy Bryce Wylde
body:
Bryce Wylde is a Toronto-based different health specialist that takes pride in difficult himself via fitness and also doing it for a great reason. Last summertime he climbed Mount Kilimanjaro to raise awareness for psychological wellness, this month he took component in Trailwalker, a 100-km race (to be finished in 48 hrs) to aid raise money for Oxfam as well as following summer season he intends to bike throughout Canada (no big deal!).

As a regular on the Dr. Oz reveal Bryce’s proficiency runs the gamut from fitness to raising energy and all-natural treatments. I caught up with the enthusiastic professional and writer prior to his 100-km race, right here’s exactly what he instructed me regarding remaining healthy and fit:

1. Allow a good reason inspire you. Bryce climbs hills and also walks numerous miles to assist raise understanding and also money for numerous causes. Yet they also aid him stay with his fitness objectives. “Health and fitness difficulties for charities as well as companies not just assist me stay energetic and healthy, they likewise help the better good. What a lot more could you ask for?” he asks. “I locate that when you set an objective like this it’s less complicated to adhere to and also you finish up obtaining far more dedicated to the individual reason.” It’s a win-win!

2. Plunge right into summertime with a cool amino acid. Currently is your chance to enjoy activities you can not do year-round, and also Bryce adores swimming. “I believe it is just one of the most effective tasks of all,” he claims. “It’s non-impact, very cardio in regards to intensity, every thing of the body is moved and also you’re melting a whole lot of calories.” After a dip in a chlorinated swimming pool, Bryce suggests taking an amino acid called taurine that aids far better eliminate the chemical.

3. Make your personal electrolyte mocktail. It is very important to stay hydrated throughout warm climate– specifically during a workout. When we sweat, our bodies launch electrolytes our body demands. You can renew them with particular foods (like bananas and also watermelon) and drinks. Bryce recommends coconut water rather than unnaturally flavoured sporting activities beverages. summary: Heart Palpitations: Coffee, Alcohol, Nicotine, Energy Drinks, Chocolate
body:
Heart Palpitations: Coffee, Alcohol, Nicotine, Energy Drinks, Chocolate

If you get heart palpitations (racing heart, pained chest, shortness of breath, pained pusle/neck, even faint spells in some cases) after consuming any of these, it’s possible you actually just have low blood sugar. It doesn’t have to actually be low at that moment to affect you either. If you suffer from low blood sugar at all you’ll probably get these effects.

Low blood sugar can also happen sometimes at random to people who don’t suffer from it usually. If you hadn’t eaten yet, best to avoid any caffeine or nicotine. Especially if you’re feeling dizzy, light headed, or feint.

If caffeine gives you heart palpitations, that’s also why it doesn’t wake you up. Instead of that boost you’ll feel exhausted. So best to cut out that morning coffee or energy drink. You’ll feel way more alert without it.

Definitely avoid 5 hour energy shots!! Anything like that is a direct hit and you’ll get the WORST symptoms. It’s literally just a hit of straight caffeine, even if it claims to be caffeine free. You’ll get VERY sick from those..

For some reason doctors don’t tell you these things when they tell you you suffer from low blood sugar. I’m not sure why, they just normally don’t. Some remember to mention this important detail but for those who won’t told… Here you go.

Hopefully many people can see this. I actually wound up nearly cracking my skull open from a feint spell when I forgot to eat and had some strong coffee on several occasions never knowing what was causing these risks.

Human beings are fragile, please take care of yourselves.
